reviews.review_msg: This class was the worst one I took so far... and Im in my last year. He would lecture with no visual aids (power points, pictures, etc) which are all often used in history. None of our assignments were handed out -ever... and of course, we never received feedback (including in-class discussions).

While I think he's a really interesting guy the class was horrible. It was cross referenced as an IS class so maybe that was part of why I found it so weird. He doesn't use visual aids, I had to complain to the department to get a response to my emails and it's the last week of school and I haven't recieved any assignments back. Do not recommend.

Dr Ray tries... She's clearly passionate but not the greatest teacher.
 She has an unfortunate tendency for interrupting her students if she thinks they're wrong or knows where their point is going. Its giving ADHD tbh. 
Attendance is mandatory but class is 90% breaking into groups and discussing readings. ðŸ™„ 
Projects are creative and fun though!

Easily one of my worst university experiences. Prof. Ray made such an interesting topic dull by cancelling lectures and assigning impossible volumes of readings. It's a highschool style environment where she cold calls, and doesn't facilitate constructive conversations. Expect to be scolded in front of your peers.

Dr. Ray did cancel many classes -- kids, injuries...etc
She really cared about the course subject and was very informative. That said we rarely got slides or any structured learning -- mostly discussion where she told us stuff. 
The assignments were creative/different, weren't hard and were enjoyable but... were marked a bit harshly.
Very lazy teacher, Cancels class last minute. Readings are over 200 pages every week. Most of the class consists of discussing the textbook in groups of 2-4. Would not take again.

Very rude, if you are not a native-speaker, she will heavily discredit your grammar in assignments.

Cancelled class less than 45min before the start.

Unprofessional.

Participation points require you to go to office hours, ask questions, email her, but when you do, she comes off as you're bothering her and to go read the syllabus.

She expects participation (20% of total grade) but is very judgmental unless you grasped exactly what she thought was important. 

She comes across as very rude and passive-aggressive when students (the whole class) highlighted how they got marked down for not using sources in her book review despite not being mandatory in the criterias.

Over 7 chapters of readings per week,makes you buy 4 books.She is very lazy, you dont learn anything in class, she sits down and makes you do group discussions for 3 hours about readings. She takes over 3 weeks to return a 500 word paper. She mocks you when she disagrees with something you say in class. Worst prof ive ever had.Made me hate learning

Such a genuine Prof. Facilitates amazing class discussions and offers a wealth of information to every topic. Lots of reading so make sure you keep on top of it, a large percentage of your grade is based on your own personal reflection to the course material so try to do that each week and it should be an easy class to do well in.

Her choice of usual assignments allowed for outside of the box thinking. I have one complaint with her grading when it comes to participation. All throughout the semester I was receiving As and then at the end of the semester I was blind sided by a bad participation grade, which she did amend after many emails. It still annoys me to this day.

Dr. Ray is fantastic! She was without a doubt my favourite prof this past semester, and is one of the best I've had in awhile. She's very caring, and was always available for extra help outside of class. She also tries to avoid using traditional assignments (20% of our grade was based on a personal journal for example) which I really liked
